Key Arguments: The legislation will erode democracy and freedom of speech in Australia.
The bill could lead to corruption through manipulation of information flows.
It may result in one-sided information flows serving ideological interests rather than national interests.
Freedom of speech is essential for holding governments accountable and fostering public debate.
Concerns from global social media companies highlight potential abuse of power.
Notable Quotes: Freedom of speech is one of the pillars of our way of life and many Australians sacrificed their lives for our freedom.
This Bill must be rejected so our thriving democracy is preserved.
Our fallen diggers must be turning in their graves.
